trans-unit.source: Provision a Spark cluster on HDInsight and use Spark SQL from Zeppelin and Jupyter for interactive analysis | Azure
trans-unit.target: Provision a Spark cluster on HDInsight and use Spark SQL from Zeppelin and Jupyter for interactive analysis | Azure

trans-unit.source: Step-by-step instructions on how to quickly provision an Apache Spark cluster in HDInsight and then use Spark SQL from Zeppelin and Jupyter notebooks to run interactive queries.
trans-unit.target: Step-by-step instructions on how to quickly provision an Apache Spark cluster in HDInsight and then use Spark SQL from Zeppelin and Jupyter notebooks to run interactive queries.

trans-unit.source: Quick Start: Provision Apache Spark on HDInsight and run interactive queries using Spark SQL
trans-unit.target: Quick Start: Provision Apache Spark on HDInsight and run interactive queries using Spark SQL

trans-unit.source: Provision Apache Spark on HDInsight and run interactive queries using Spark SQL
trans-unit.target: Provision Apache Spark on HDInsight and run interactive queries using Spark SQL

trans-unit.source: Learn how to provision an Apache Spark cluster in HDInsight using the Quick Create option and then use the web-based [Zeppelin](https://zeppelin.incubator.apache.org) and [Jupyter](https://jupyter.org) notebooks to run Spark SQL interactive queries on the Spark cluster.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to provision an Apache Spark cluster in HDInsight using the Quick Create option and then use the web-based [Zeppelin](https://zeppelin.incubator.apache.org) and [Jupyter](https://jupyter.org) notebooks to run Spark SQL interactive queries on the Spark cluster.

trans-unit.source: Get started using Apache Spark in HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Get started using Apache Spark in HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites:
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites:

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have an Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have an Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: See [Get Azure free trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).
trans-unit.target: See [Get Azure free trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure Storage account
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure Storage account

trans-unit.source: When you provision an HDInsight cluster in HDInsight, you specify an Azure Storage account.
trans-unit.target: When you provision an HDInsight cluster in HDInsight, you specify an Azure Storage account.

trans-unit.source: A specific Blob storage container from that account is designated as the default file system.
trans-unit.target: A specific Blob storage container from that account is designated as the default file system.

trans-unit.source: By default, the HDInsight cluster is provisioned in the same data center as the storage account you specify.
trans-unit.target: By default, the HDInsight cluster is provisioned in the same data center as the storage account you specify.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Use Azure Blob storage with HDInsight][hdinsight-storage].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Use Azure Blob storage with HDInsight][hdinsight-storage].

trans-unit.source: To create an Azure Storage account
trans-unit.target: To create an Azure Storage account

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure Portal][azure-management-portal].
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure Portal][azure-management-portal].

trans-unit.source: Click **NEW** in the lower-left corner and then enter the values as shown in the image.
trans-unit.target: Click **NEW** in the lower-left corner and then enter the values as shown in the image.

trans-unit.source: Azure portal where you can use Quick Create to set up a new storage account
trans-unit.target: Azure portal where you can use Quick Create to set up a new storage account

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Make sure you create the storage account in a location that is supported for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Make sure you create the storage account in a location that is supported for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Select the new storage account from the list and click **MANAGE ACCESS KEYS** at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Select the new storage account from the list and click **MANAGE ACCESS KEYS** at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Make a note of the **PRIMARY ACCESS KEY** (or the **SECONDARY ACCESS KEY**—either of the keys work).
trans-unit.target: Make a note of the **PRIMARY ACCESS KEY** (or the **SECONDARY ACCESS KEY**—either of the keys work).

trans-unit.source: You will need this later in the tutorial.
trans-unit.target: You will need this later in the tutorial.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [How to Create a Storage Account][azure-create-storageaccount] .
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [How to Create a Storage Account][azure-create-storageaccount] .

trans-unit.source: Provision an HDInsight Spark cluster
trans-unit.target: Provision an HDInsight Spark cluster

trans-unit.source: In this section, you provision an HDInsight version 3.2 cluster, which is based on Spark version 1.3.1.
trans-unit.target: In this section, you provision an HDInsight version 3.2 cluster, which is based on Spark version 1.3.1.

trans-unit.source: For information about HDInsight versions and their SLAs, see [HDInsight component versioning](hdinsight-component-versioning.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about HDInsight versions and their SLAs, see [HDInsight component versioning](hdinsight-component-versioning.md).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The steps in this article create an Apache Spark cluster in HDInsight by using basic configuration settings.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The steps in this article create an Apache Spark cluster in HDInsight by using basic configuration settings.

trans-unit.source: For information about other cluster configuration settings (such as using additional storage, Azure virtual network, or a metastore for Hive), see [Provision HDInsight clusters using custom options](hdinsight-apache-spark-provision-clusters.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about other cluster configuration settings (such as using additional storage, Azure virtual network, or a metastore for Hive), see [Provision HDInsight clusters using custom options](hdinsight-apache-spark-provision-clusters.md).

trans-unit.source: To provision a Spark cluster
trans-unit.target: To provision a Spark cluster

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure Portal][azure-management-portal].
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure Portal][azure-management-portal].

trans-unit.source: Click **NEW** in the lower-left corner and then enter the values as shown in the image.
trans-unit.target: Click **NEW** in the lower-left corner and then enter the values as shown in the image.

trans-unit.source: Create a Spark cluster in HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Create a Spark cluster in HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Run interactive Spark SQL queries using a Zeppelin notebook
trans-unit.target: Run interactive Spark SQL queries using a Zeppelin notebook

trans-unit.source: After you have provisioned a cluster, you can use a web-based Zeppelin notebook to run Spark SQL interactive queries against the Spark HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: After you have provisioned a cluster, you can use a web-based Zeppelin notebook to run Spark SQL interactive queries against the Spark HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: In this section, we will use a sample data file (hvac.csv) available by default on the cluster to run some interactive Spark SQL queries.
trans-unit.target: In this section, we will use a sample data file (hvac.csv) available by default on the cluster to run some interactive Spark SQL queries.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The notebook you create following the instructions below is also available by default on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The notebook you create following the instructions below is also available by default on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: After you have launched Zeppelin, you will find this notebook by the name **Zeppelin HVAC tutorial**.
trans-unit.target: After you have launched Zeppelin, you will find this notebook by the name **Zeppelin HVAC tutorial**.

trans-unit.source: Launch the Zeppelin notebook.
trans-unit.target: Launch the Zeppelin notebook.

trans-unit.source: Select your newly-created Spark cluster on the Azure portal, and from the portal task bar at the bottom, click **Zeppelin Notebook**.
trans-unit.target: Select your newly-created Spark cluster on the Azure portal, and from the portal task bar at the bottom, click **Zeppelin Notebook**.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, enter the admin credentials for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, enter the admin credentials for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Follow the instructions on the page that opens up to launch the notebook.
trans-unit.target: Follow the instructions on the page that opens up to launch the notebook.

trans-unit.source: Create a new notebook.
trans-unit.target: Create a new notebook.

trans-unit.source: From the header pane, click **Notebook**, and then click **Create New Note**.
trans-unit.target: From the header pane, click **Notebook**, and then click **Create New Note**.

trans-unit.source: Create a new Zeppelin notebook
trans-unit.target: Create a new Zeppelin notebook

trans-unit.source: On the same page, under the **Notebook** heading, you should see a new notebook with the name starting with **Note XXXXXXXXX**.
trans-unit.target: On the same page, under the **Notebook** heading, you should see a new notebook with the name starting with **Note XXXXXXXXX**.

trans-unit.source: Click the new notebook.
trans-unit.target: Click the new notebook.

trans-unit.source: On the web page for the new notebook, click the heading, and change the name of the notebook if you want to.
trans-unit.target: On the web page for the new notebook, click the heading, and change the name of the notebook if you want to.

trans-unit.source: Press ENTER to save the name change.
trans-unit.target: Press ENTER to save the name change.

trans-unit.source: Also, make sure the notebook header shows a **Connected** status in the top-right corner.
trans-unit.target: Also, make sure the notebook header shows a **Connected** status in the top-right corner.

trans-unit.source: Zeppelin notebook status
trans-unit.target: Zeppelin notebook status

trans-unit.source: Load sample data into a temporary table.
trans-unit.target: Load sample data into a temporary table.

trans-unit.source: When you provision a Spark cluster in HDInsight, the sample data file, **hvac.csv**, is copied to the associated storage account under **\HdiSamples\SensorSampleData\hvac**.
trans-unit.target: When you provision a Spark cluster in HDInsight, the sample data file, **hvac.csv**, is copied to the associated storage account under **\HdiSamples\SensorSampleData\hvac**.

trans-unit.source: In the empty paragraph that is created by default in the new notebook, paste the following snippet.
trans-unit.target: In the empty paragraph that is created by default in the new notebook, paste the following snippet.

trans-unit.source: Press **SHIFT + ENTER** or click the **Play** button for the paragraph to run the snippet.
trans-unit.target: Press **SHIFT + ENTER** or click the **Play** button for the paragraph to run the snippet.

trans-unit.source: The status on the right-corner of the paragraph should progress from READY, PENDING, RUNNING to FINISHED.
trans-unit.target: The status on the right-corner of the paragraph should progress from READY, PENDING, RUNNING to FINISHED.

trans-unit.source: The output shows up at the bottom of the same paragraph.
trans-unit.target: The output shows up at the bottom of the same paragraph.

trans-unit.source: The screenshot looks like the following:
trans-unit.target: The screenshot looks like the following:

trans-unit.source: Create a temporary table from raw data
trans-unit.target: Create a temporary table from raw data

trans-unit.source: You can also provide a title to each paragraph.
trans-unit.target: You can also provide a title to each paragraph.

trans-unit.source: From the right-hand corner, click the **Settings** icon, and then click **Show title**.
trans-unit.target: From the right-hand corner, click the **Settings** icon, and then click **Show title**.

trans-unit.source: You can now run Spark SQL statements on the **hvac** table.
trans-unit.target: You can now run Spark SQL statements on the **hvac** table.

trans-unit.source: Paste the following query in a new paragraph.
trans-unit.target: Paste the following query in a new paragraph.

trans-unit.source: The query retrieves the building ID and the difference between the target and actual temperatures for each building on a given date.
trans-unit.target: The query retrieves the building ID and the difference between the target and actual temperatures for each building on a given date.

trans-unit.source: Press **SHIFT + ENTER**.
trans-unit.target: Press **SHIFT + ENTER**.

trans-unit.source: The **%sql** statement at the beginning tells the notebook to use the Spark SQL interpreter.
trans-unit.target: The **%sql** statement at the beginning tells the notebook to use the Spark SQL interpreter.

trans-unit.source: You can look at the defined interpreters from the **Interpreter** tab in the notebook header.
trans-unit.target: You can look at the defined interpreters from the **Interpreter** tab in the notebook header.

trans-unit.source: The following screenshot shows the output.
trans-unit.target: The following screenshot shows the output.

trans-unit.source: Run a Spark SQL statement using the notebook
trans-unit.target: Run a Spark SQL statement using the notebook

trans-unit.source: Click the display options (highlighted in rectangle) to switch between different representations for the same output.
trans-unit.target: Click the display options (highlighted in rectangle) to switch between different representations for the same output.

trans-unit.source: Click **Settings** to choose what consitutes the key and values in the output.
trans-unit.target: Click **Settings** to choose what consitutes the key and values in the output.

trans-unit.source: The screen capture above uses **buildingID** as the key and the average of **temp_diff** as the value.
trans-unit.target: The screen capture above uses **buildingID** as the key and the average of **temp_diff** as the value.

trans-unit.source: You can also run Spark SQL statements using variables in the query.
trans-unit.target: You can also run Spark SQL statements using variables in the query.

trans-unit.source: The next snippet shows how to define a variable, **Temp**, in the query with the possible values you want to query with.
trans-unit.target: The next snippet shows how to define a variable, **Temp**, in the query with the possible values you want to query with.

trans-unit.source: When you first run the query, a drop-down is automatically populated with the values you specified for the variable.
trans-unit.target: When you first run the query, a drop-down is automatically populated with the values you specified for the variable.

trans-unit.source: Paste this snippet in a new paragraph and press **SHIFT + ENTER**.
trans-unit.target: Paste this snippet in a new paragraph and press **SHIFT + ENTER**.

trans-unit.source: The following screenshot shows the output.
trans-unit.target: The following screenshot shows the output.

trans-unit.source: Run a Spark SQL statement using the notebook
trans-unit.target: Run a Spark SQL statement using the notebook

trans-unit.source: For subsequent queries, you can select a new value from the drop-down and run the query again.
trans-unit.target: For subsequent queries, you can select a new value from the drop-down and run the query again.

trans-unit.source: Click **Settings** to choose what consitutes the key and values in the output.
trans-unit.target: Click **Settings** to choose what consitutes the key and values in the output.

trans-unit.source: The screen capture above uses **buildingID** as the key, the average of **temp_diff** as the value, and **targettemp** as the group.
trans-unit.target: The screen capture above uses **buildingID** as the key, the average of **temp_diff** as the value, and **targettemp** as the group.

trans-unit.source: Restart the Spark SQL interpreter to exit the application.
trans-unit.target: Restart the Spark SQL interpreter to exit the application.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Interpreter** tab at the top, and for the Spark interpreter, click **Restart**.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Interpreter** tab at the top, and for the Spark interpreter, click **Restart**.

trans-unit.source: Restart the Zeppelin intepreter
trans-unit.target: Restart the Zeppelin intepreter

trans-unit.source: Run Spark SQL queries using a Jupyter notebook
trans-unit.target: Run Spark SQL queries using a Jupyter notebook

trans-unit.source: In this section, you use a Jupyter notebook to run Spark SQL queries against a Spark cluster.
trans-unit.target: In this section, you use a Jupyter notebook to run Spark SQL queries against a Spark cluster.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The notebook you create following the instructions below is also available by default on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The notebook you create following the instructions below is also available by default on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: After you have launched Jupyter, you will find this notebook by the name **HVACTutorial.ipynb**.
trans-unit.target: After you have launched Jupyter, you will find this notebook by the name **HVACTutorial.ipynb**.

trans-unit.source: Launch the Jupyter notebook.
trans-unit.target: Launch the Jupyter notebook.

trans-unit.source: Select your Spark cluster on the Azure portal, and from the portal task bar at the bottom, click **Jupyter Notebook**.
trans-unit.target: Select your Spark cluster on the Azure portal, and from the portal task bar at the bottom, click **Jupyter Notebook**.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, enter the admin credentials for the Spark cluster.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, enter the admin credentials for the Spark cluster.

trans-unit.source: Create a new notebook.
trans-unit.target: Create a new notebook.

trans-unit.source: Click **New**, and then click **Python2**.
trans-unit.target: Click **New**, and then click **Python2**.

trans-unit.source: Create a new Jupyter notebook
trans-unit.target: Create a new Jupyter notebook

trans-unit.source: A new notebook is created and opened with the name Untitled.pynb.
trans-unit.target: A new notebook is created and opened with the name Untitled.pynb.

trans-unit.source: Click the notebook name at the top, and enter a friendly name.
trans-unit.target: Click the notebook name at the top, and enter a friendly name.

trans-unit.source: Provide a name for the notebook
trans-unit.target: Provide a name for the notebook

trans-unit.source: Import the required modules and create the Spark and SQL contexts.
trans-unit.target: Import the required modules and create the Spark and SQL contexts.

trans-unit.source: Paste the following snippet in an empty cell, and then press **SHIFT + ENTER**.
trans-unit.target: Paste the following snippet in an empty cell, and then press **SHIFT + ENTER**.

trans-unit.source: Everytime you run a job in Jupyter, your web browser window title will show a **(Busy)** status along with the notebook title.
trans-unit.target: Everytime you run a job in Jupyter, your web browser window title will show a **(Busy)** status along with the notebook title.

trans-unit.source: You will also see a solid circle next to the **Python 2** text in the top-right corner.
trans-unit.target: You will also see a solid circle next to the **Python 2** text in the top-right corner.

trans-unit.source: After the job completes, this will change to a hollow circle.
trans-unit.target: After the job completes, this will change to a hollow circle.

trans-unit.source: Status of a Jupyter notebook job
trans-unit.target: Status of a Jupyter notebook job

trans-unit.source: Load sample data into a temporary table.
trans-unit.target: Load sample data into a temporary table.

trans-unit.source: When you provision a Spark cluster in HDInsight, the sample data file, **hvac.csv**, is copied to the associated storage account under **\HdiSamples\SensorSampleData\hvac**.
trans-unit.target: When you provision a Spark cluster in HDInsight, the sample data file, **hvac.csv**, is copied to the associated storage account under **\HdiSamples\SensorSampleData\hvac**.

trans-unit.source: In an empty cell, paste the following snippet and press **SHIFT + ENTER**.
trans-unit.target: In an empty cell, paste the following snippet and press **SHIFT + ENTER**.

trans-unit.source: This snippet registers the data into a temporary table called **hvac**.
trans-unit.target: This snippet registers the data into a temporary table called **hvac**.

trans-unit.source: Once the job completes successfully, the following output is displayed.
trans-unit.target: Once the job completes successfully, the following output is displayed.

trans-unit.source: Restart the kernel to exit the application.
trans-unit.target: Restart the kernel to exit the application.

trans-unit.source: From the top menu bar, click **Kernel**, click **Restart**, and then click **Restart** again at the prompt.
trans-unit.target: From the top menu bar, click **Kernel**, click **Restart**, and then click **Restart** again at the prompt.

trans-unit.source: Restart the Jupyter Kernel
trans-unit.target: Restart the Jupyter Kernel
